member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmConfigureButtons.#ctor(System.Data.OleDb.OleDbConnection)
member.summary: Initialize the query, and extract the data that query defines into a DataSet with corresponding DataTable. Populate the list and set up list attributes.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmConfigureButtons.cmdMoveUp_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Clicking this button calls the function that moves the first selected item up in the list, and raises the event to the main form so that the buttons can be redrawn to correspond to the new order.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmConfigureButtons.cmdMoveDown_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Clicking this button calls the function that moves the first selected item down in the list, and raises the event to the main form so that the buttons can be redrawn to correspond to the new order.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmConfigureButtons.MoveListViewItem(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Move the first selected item up in the list, and raise the event to the main form so that the buttons can be redrawn to correspond to the new order.
member.param: If true, the item will be moved up the list (when possible). If false, it will be moved down (when possible)

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmConfigureButtons.cmdCreateNewButton_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Clicking this button will bring up the 'add button' dialog which allows the definition of a new button.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmConfigureButtons.cmdEditButton_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Clicking this button will bring up the 'add button' dialog which will allow the editing of the current button's attributes.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmConfigureButtons.cmdDone_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Pressing this button will Hide the dialog

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmConfigureButtons.UpdateDrawingOrder(System.String)
member.summary: Changes the database values for the 'DrawingOrder' field to reflect the change in drawing order.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmConfigureButtons.cmdDeleteButton_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Clicking this button will remove the selected button from the project, including from the database.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmConfigureButtons.cmdMoveToPanel_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Clickng this button results in the first selected button being moved to the other panel. The database will also have the entry moved from one button table to the other.

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.VIDEO_TIME_FORMAT
member.summary: Default format for the time labels

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.FRAMES_TO_SKIP
member.summary: Default number of frames to skip when incrementally stepping through the frames

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_strVideoTimeFormat
member.summary: Member variable to hold the time format to show on the video labels and in CurrentVideoTimeFormatted property

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_tsDurationTime
member.summary: Member variable to hold the video's duration or length.

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_tsCurrentVideoTime
member.summary: Member variable to hold the video's current ti

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_blFirstTick
member.summary: Member variable to hold whether or not this is the first tick in the System.Timer's tick events

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_blChapter
member.summary: Member variable to hold UNKNOWN

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_blRecordPerSecond
member.summary: Member variable to hold whether or not to record data every second

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_blIsEndOfVideo
member.summary: Member variable to hold whether or not the video is at the end

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_dblRate
member.summary: Member variable to hold the rate the video will be played at

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_strFilename
member.summary: Member variable to hold the filename

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_sngFPS
member.summary: Member variable to hold the frames per second for the video

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_mbMedia
member.summary: Member variable to hold the media (video file)

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_intFramesToSkip
member.summary: The number of frames to skip when incrementally stepping forward through frames

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_pnlTransparentPanel
member.summary: Member variable to hold the transparent panel used to overlay the Vlc.DotNet control so that the user can click on the video to toggle play/pause

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Default constructor. The label time format will be the default. Current time and Duration are set to zero.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor with custom time format string. Should look something like this: "{0:D2}:{1:D2}:{2:D2}.{3:D2}" Current time and Duration are set to zero.

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.Position
member.summary: This property contains the position of the currently loaded video.

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.IsPlaying
member.summary: This property is readonly and contains a boolean which is True if the media state of the VLC.dotnet control is Vlc.DotNet.Core.Interops.Signatures.LibVlc.Media.States.Playing

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.IsStopped
member.summary: This property is readonly and contains a boolean which is True if the media state of the VLC.dotnet control is Vlc.DotNet.Core.Interops.Signatures.LibVlc.Media.States.Stopped

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.IsPaused
member.summary: This property is readonly and contains a boolean which is True if the media state of the VLC.dotnet control is Vlc.DotNet.Core.Interops.Signatures.LibVlc.Media.States.Paused

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.IsEndOfVideo
member.summary: This property contains a boolean which is True if the media has reached the end of the video

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.CurrentVideoTimeFormatted
member.summary: This property is readonly and returns a formatted string representing the time at the current position of the video. The formatting string is defined in the constructor (either default or custom).

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.CurrentVideoTime
member.summary: This property is readonly and returns a System.Timespan object representing the time at the current position of the video.

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.FPS
member.summary: This property is readonly and contains a number of type 'Single' which represents the Frames per Second for the video.
member.remarks: Note this almost always returns 0 so it's use is limited

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.Rate
member.summary: This property contains a number of type 'Double' which represents the play rate for the video. For normal playback this will be 1.0. For double spped, it will be 2.0
member.value: Double number greater or equal to 0.0

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.Filename
member.summary: This property contains a 'String' which represents the filename for the video.

member.name: E:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.PauseEvent
member.summary: This event is triggered when the user pauses the video from within this form.

member.name: E:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.PlayEvent
member.summary: This event is triggered when the user plays the video from within this form.

member.name: E:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.StopEvent
member.summary: This event is triggered when the user stops the video from within this

member.name: E:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.VideoEndedEvent
member.summary: This event is triggered when the video has ended.

member.name: E:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.ClosingEvent
member.summary: This event is triggered when the frmVideoPlayer form is closed by clicking the 'X' top right of the window.

member.name: E:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.TimerTickEvent
member.summary: This event is triggered when the timer ticks. It is used to send a signal so that the parent will always have access to the correct data (current time) from the video.

member.name: E:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.RightArrowPressedEvent
member.summary: If the Right arrow key is pressed inside this form, this event will be raised

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.frmVideoPlayer_Load(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Loads the fmrVideoPlayer form. All member variables are initialized, and the video file is opened as a new Vlc.DotNet.Core.Medias.PathMedia object. A System.Timer is started to generate update events every 500ms.
member.param: System.Object
System.EventArgs

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.frmVideoPlayer_FormClosing(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.FormClosingEventArgs)
member.summary: Unloads the frmVideoPLayer form. The player and timer are stopped and the ClosingEvent is fired
member.param: System.Object
System.Windows.Forms.FormClosingEventArgs

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.playVideo
member.summary: Plays the video and change the picturebox icon to reflect this. Fires the PlayEvent.
member.returns: True or False for success. False is returned if the media was not loaded correctly or an exception was thrown
member.remarks: If IsEndOfVideo is True and either IsStopped or IsPaused is True, that means that the player is at the end and the play request will attempt to reset the player to the beginning

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.pauseVideo
member.summary: Pause the video and change the picturebox icon to reflect this. Fires the PauseEvent.
member.returns: True or False for success. Only returns False if an exception is thrown

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.stopVideo
member.summary: Stop the video and change the picturebox icon to reflect this. Fires the StopEvent.
member.returns: True or False for success. Only returns False if an exception is thrown

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.tmrVideo_Tick(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Handles the System.timer tick event. If it is the first one, set up the duration label (the duration cannot be read until the video has started playing). If the video has reached it's duration, fire EndedEvent. At all other times, update the label for the current time that the video has reached.
member.param: System.Object
System.EventArgs
member.remarks: On the first tick, adds a transparent panel to allow user clicks on the video, since the Vlc.DotNet control does not allow it.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.stepForward(System.Object)
member.summary: Step forward a number of frames in the video and adjust player controls accordingly
member.param: Number of frames to skip, typically between 50 and 1000
member.remarks: This is highly dependent on the Vlc.DotNet control and can be buggy depending on the filetype

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.getCurrentTime
member.summary: Get the current time from the Position property and the duration of the video.
member.remarks: Multiplies the current position (which is between 0 and 1) by the duration of the video and converts that to a Timespan object.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.trkCurrentPosition_MovePointer(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: This mouse handler handles both MouseDown and MouseMove Events for the trackbar. If you press on the trackbar and move it, the video will pause,then seek to that spot and remain paused.
member.param: System.Object
System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.trkCurrentPosition_MouseUp(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: The trackbar MouseUp event just pauses the video. This is here to ensure the video remains paused after seeking with the trackbar
member.param: System.Object
System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.m_pnlTransparentPanel_MouseClick(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: This handles the user clicking on the video by using a transparent panel overlaid on the video. The video will toggle between paused and playing. The Vlc.DotNet control does not capture MouseClick Events on its own so the transparent panel was needed.
member.param: System.Object
System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs
member.remarks: If the user clicks the right mouse button, a simple help dialog will pop up

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.videoContextMenuChoice(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This is the help dialog that appears when the user clicks the right mouse button in the video window.
member.param: System.Object
System.EventArgs

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.plyrVideo_Ended
member.summary: This handles the Event 'EndReached' fired by the Vlc.DotNet control.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.endOfVideo
member.summary: The end of the video has been reached. Do some updating on the form and raise the VideoEnded event.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.getFormattedCurrentVideoTimeString
member.summary: Returns a formatted string for the current video time
member.returns: A formatted string or an unformatted string if an exception was thrown

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.getFormattedDurationString
member.summary: Returns a formatted string for the duration video time
member.returns: A formatted string or an unformatted string if an exception was thrown

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.lblDuration_TextChanged(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Handles the case when extra decimal points are being shown
member.remarks: Works in tandem with lblDuration_Resize(sender As System.Object, e As System.EventArgs) Handles lblDuration.Resize

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.lblDuration_Resize(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: When the duration label automatically resizes due to extra decimal points being shown, this will make it grow left so that it remains looking good.
member.remarks: Works in tandem with lblDuration_TextChanged(sender As System.Object, e As System.EventArgs) Handles lblDuration.TextChanged

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer.ProcessCmdKey(System.Windows.Forms.Message@,System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Required to override the default behaviour of the arrow keypresses in the form
member.returns: True if the right arrow was pressed
member.remarks: Raises the RightArrowPressedEvent

member.name: T:VideoMiner.frmVideoPlayer
member.summary: The frmVideoPlayer class provides a form with an instance of the VLC.dotnet control, a trackbar to show the position of the video, a label for the current position, a label for the duration of the video clip, and a picturebox which shows what is currently happening with the video (playing, stopped, paused).

member.name: T:VideoMiner.frmSetTime.WhichTimeEnum
member.summary: Used to keep track of which time the m_tsUserTime variable is set to

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmSetTime.m_enumWhichTime
member.summary: Keeps track of which time the m_tsUserTime variabel is set to

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmSetTime.m_tsUserTime
member.summary: Stores the Timespan object representing the user time

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmSetTime.WhichTime
member.summary: One of the WhichTimeEnum enumeration values, representing which type of time is currently in use

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmSetTime.UserTime
member.summary: UserTime is a TimeSpan property representing the user time

member.name: P:VideoMiner.frmSetTime.TimeSource
member.summary: The Timesource in use, one of the values in the WhichTimeEnum enumerationm

member.name: E:VideoMiner.frmSetTime.TimeChanged
member.summary: When the user clicks the 'OK' button this event is raised

member.name: E:VideoMiner.frmSetTime.TimeSourceChange
member.summary: Signal that the user has requested a time source change, eg. from COMPUTER to GPS

member.summary: When the user clicks the 'GPS Time' radiobutton this event is raised

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmSetTime.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor
member.remarks: Sets the UserTime property to TimeSpan.Zero

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmSetTime.#ctor(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: Sets the UserTime property in the constructor to tsUserTime

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmSetTime.frmSetTime_Load(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Load the form, set the time textbox up to show the current user time.

member.summary: Handles when the user clicks the 'OK' button.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmSetTime.ChangeSource(VideoMiner.frmSetTime.WhichTimeEnum)
member.summary: Change the time source type. Also set the textbox background, font, and value

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmSetTime.setTextTime
member.summary: Set the text in the Time TextBox to be the hours, minutes, seconds, and milliseconds (rounded to 2 decimal places) of the current time

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmSetTime.getTextTime
member.summary: Stores the text time as written in the TextBox into a member variable stored as a Timespan object.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmSetTime.rbManualTime_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Handle the click of the radiobutton to allow the user to manually set the time

member.summary: Handle the click of the button to set the time to zero

member.summary: Handle the click of the button to set the time to the current time on this computer

member.summary: Handle the click of the button to set the time to the GPS connection's time

member.summary: Handle the click of the button to set the time to the GPS connection's time

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmSetTime.validateTimeEntry
member.summary: Check the user input to make sure it is a valid time. Returns True if valid, False otherwise

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmSetTime.processOK
member.summary: Processes a click of the OK button or when the Enter key is pressed. Verifies that the time in the textbox it of correct format and if so, Raises the TimeChanged Event before hiding the form.

member.summary: Get a point location from a NMEA string

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmSpeciesEvent.pnlSpeciesEvent_Paint(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: When the SpeciesEventForm is displayed, draw a red arc at the bottom of the form with an attatched red line going to the top of the form. This line helps a user visualize the center line, and ranges to the left or right of the center line.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmSpeciesEvent.ok_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: 1.) If the user has not selected "On Centerline" and either the portRangeTextbox or the starboardRangeTextBox are not filled in or are not numeric, alert the user to fill them in with an integer. 2.) Else if "On Centerline" has been selected or "On Centerline" has not been selected AND portRangeTextbox and starboardRangeTextBox have both been flled in, then, hide the SpeciesEventForm

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmSpeciesEvent.validate_range(System.Windows.Forms.TextBox)
member.summary: Description: Function to validate value being passed to it is not null and is numeric.

member.summary: Used for validating text entered into a text box

member.summary: Return the name of the currently chosen project name to be deleted

member.summary: Place all names in the supplied list Collection into the ListBox. Refreshes the list everytime it is called, i.e. clears the list and rebuilds it based on the list Collection

member.summary: Enable or disable the delete button depending on whether or not there is a valid selection

member.summary: Enable or disable the delete button depending on whether or not there is a valid selection

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.GPS_TIMEOUT
member.summary: Default timeout value used in form load event

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.TIMEOUT_DEFAULT
member.summary: Value of default connection and read timeout in seconds

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_intSearchingCounter
member.summary: Counter to keep track of timer ticks during connection attempt. Connection timeout counter.

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_lngConnectedCounter
member.summary: Counter to keep track of timer ticks for data received, used to make sure the data keep coming in once a connectioin is established

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_tsLastTimeDataReceived
member.summary: The date and time of the last data received. Used with m_lngConnectedCounter to figure out if the connection has been terminated.

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_spSerialPort
member.summary: The serial port object, withevents so we can handle the DataReceived event

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_strComPort
member.summary: Name of the COM port, eg. "COM1"

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_strNMEAStringType
member.summary: The NMEA string to use for data filtering, eg. "GPGGA"

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_strParity
member.summary: Parity value for the serial port connection, eg. "NONE"

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_intBaudRate
member.summary: Baud rate for the serial port connection, eg. 4800

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_dblStopBits
member.summary: Stop bits for the serial port connection, eg. 1.5

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_intDataBits
member.summary: Data bits for the serial port connection, eg. 8

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_intTimeout
member.summary: Timeout in seconds for the serial port connection

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_blSendChosenStringsOnly
member.summary: If true, only the chosen NMEA strings will be sent to the data viewer form. If false, all incoming NMEA strings will be sent.

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_blFirstTimeConnected
member.summary: Because the connected variable is set everytime good data are received, this is required to keep track of the first time it is connected. This allows the form to raise a GPSConnected event one time only, upon connection.

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_blConnected
member.summary: True if the GPS data of the given NMEA string are being received, false otherwise

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_dblGPSX
member.summary: GPS X value (latitude) in the format DDMM.MMMM
member.remarks: D=Degrees, M=Minutes

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_dblGPSY
member.summary: GPS Y value (longitude) in the format DDMM.MMMM
member.remarks: D=Degrees, M=Minutes

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_dblGPSZ
member.summary: GPS Z value (elevation) in meters

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_dblGPSTime
member.summary: GPS time value in the format HHMMSS
member.remarks: H=Hour, M=Minute, S=Second

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_tsGPSTime
member.summary: GPS time value as a TimeSpan object

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_strCurrData
member.summary: A string which holds the most recent good data, which means data that matched the NMEA string requested

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_blDataGood
member.summary: True if m_strCurrData is good, that is if it is good and the connection is still good. If the connection was lost for the 'timeout' period then this will be set to False even if m_strCurrData appears good.

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_frmStringDataViewer
member.summary: A form which shows the authenticated data strings in a textbox in real time

member.summary: Timer for the check to make sure connectivity is maintained.
member.remarks: Had to be a system threading timer due to SerialPort.DataReceived being in another thread

member.name: F:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.m_tmrcbTimerDelegate
member.summary: Callback delegate for m_tmrTimerItem

member.summary: Exposes the SerialPort Object

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the GPS settings form. Adds ComboBox choices for COM Port, Baud rate, Parity, Stop bits, and Data bits

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.SetSerialPortVariables
member.summary: Set the member variables to be what they currently are in the form selections controls.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.ConnectSerialPort
member.summary: Try to connect the serial port with the currently selected values on the textbox

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.RefreshStatus
member.summary: Refresh all window controls based on connectivity of the serial port object. Raises the connected event. Also append the newest good data line to the port data viewer form.
member.remarks: This subroutine is thread safe. Raises the GPSConnected or GPSDisconnected events via a delegate

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.cmdOK_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Clicking the OK button just hides the form so the connection, if working, will remain for the caller to access

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.cmdConnection_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Toggle to connect or disconnect the serial port

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.ClosePortThread
member.summary: Creates a new thread to close the port because of an issue with the method

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.CloseSerialPort
member.summary: Close the serial port and reset form member variables to reflect change

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.tmrGPSTimeout_Tick(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Handles the connection timeout timer. If timeout period has expired, a ReadLine is done on the stream and if it is unsuccessful the port will be closed and a message issued. If it succeeds then the connection is assumed good.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.GetData(System.String)
member.summary: Checks the current data string for compliance with the chosen NMEA string If it is correct, the connected property will be set to true, the connection timeout timer will be stopped and the data will be extracted. If any of the key fields (time, lat, long, elevation) are empty strings then set the data as bad and exit.

member.name: T:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.StateObjClass
member.summary: Used to hold parameters for calls to TimerTask.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.TimerTask(System.Object)
member.summary: Task to run when the threaded timer is started. The timer checks to make sure less than 'timeout' seconds has occurred since the last successful data grab.
member.param: The thread state class (StateObjClass)

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.SerialPort_DataReceived(System.Object,System.IO.Ports.SerialDataReceivedEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles data coming in on the serial port. The first time this happens, the port will be officially "connected".
member.remarks: The serial port launches this event on another thread, which is why there are all the marshalled BeginInvokes in this function, all UI updating must be marshalled in this way or there will be unspecified behaviour (freezing/deadlocks)

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.cmdViewPortData_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Opens a port data viewing form (frmStringDataViewer)

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.txtDataBits_KeyPress(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.KeyPressEventArgs)
member.summary: Prevent non-digits from being entered in DataBits textbox

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.txtTimeout_KeyPress(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.KeyPressEventArgs)
member.summary: Prevent non-digits from being entered in Timeout textbox

member.name: M:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings.DisableAll
member.summary: Disables all controls on the form except the Cancel button. Useful when there are no com ports available

member.name: T:VideoMiner.frmGpsSettings
member.summary: Form for connecting a GPS device to a serial port.
member.remarks: Many things can happen with serial ports, the user can unplug their device suddenly, turn the data-sending off, change some setting on the device itself, turn off the device. This class attempts to account for all of these situations by constantly checking data values and refreshing the status. The RefreshStatus function refreshes all controls to match what the serial port is doing and also raises the events 'GPSConnectedEvent' and 'GPSDisconnectedEvent'.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.modGlobals.SingleQuote(System.String)
member.summary: Place single quotes (') around a String
member.param: The string to place single quotes around
member.remarks: Used for database query string building in VideoMiner

member.name: M:VideoMiner.modGlobals.DoubleQuote(System.String)
member.summary: Place double quotes (") around a String
member.param: The string to place double quotes around
member.remarks: Used for database query string building in VideoMiner

member.name: M:VideoMiner.modGlobals.numericTextboxValidation(System.Windows.Forms.KeyPressEventArgs@)
member.summary: Validates text entered into TextBoxes in the project
member.param: System.Windows.Forms.KeyPressEventArgs
member.remarks: Allows only digits, period, and backspace to be used in a TextBox

member.name: M:VideoMiner.modGlobals.ToMilitaryTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Change a given time into military (24 hour) time
member.param: DateTime
member.returns: String representing the time in 24-hour format
member.remarks: If the number of milliseconds in the time is greater than 500, the seconds will be rounded up by one

member.name: M:VideoMiner.modGlobals.pad0(System.Int32)
member.summary: Pad a string of length 1 with a zero. Used to make things like hours=0 into hours="00"

member.name: M:VideoMiner.modGlobals.InvokeAction``1(System.Action{``0},``0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Will raise an event across threads
member.remarks: Used to raise events from a side-thread to the UI thread by marshaling the call Example: Write a subroutine to raise the event Protected Overridable Sub GPSConnected() RaiseEvent GPSConnectedEvent() End Sub Then invoke it like this: InvokeAction(AddressOf GPSConnected, New EventArgs()) Code from: http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/21168/Raising-Events-from-Other-Threads

member.name: T:VideoMiner.modGlobals
member.summary: This module defines 'Global' variables and functions.
member.remarks: Think hard before adding something here, especially new classes. The program should remain object-oriented as much as possible and adding things here will likely break that

member.name: T:VideoMiner.frmTableView
member.summary: This form will show a table which will be loaded from the database

member.summary: The working directory of the software

member.name: F:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.m_strConfigFilePath
member.summary: The configuration directory for the software
member.remarks: This will be the directory given by (m_strWorkingPath)\Config

member.name: F:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.m_strConfigFile
member.summary: The full path for the configuration file

member.summary: Holds the last known database path as entered by the user in the OpenFileDialog

member.summary: Holds the full path filename as entered by the user in the OpenFileDialog

member.summary: Holds the last known video file path as entered by the user in the OpenFileDialog Does not hold the filename itself

member.name: F:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.m_strVideoFile
member.summary: Hold the currently loaded video's filename without path information

member.name: F:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.m_strSessionPath
member.summary: Holds the path of the last known session's path as entered by the user in the OpenFileDialog

member.name: F:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.m_tsUserTime
member.summary: Holds the user time as set by the frmSetTime form. This is the master time object to be used by all functions when data are recorded.

member.name: F:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.m_GPS_X
member.summary: Holds the GPS X value (latitude). If a GPS device is not connected, this will be a default value as set in the load function for this form.

member.name: F:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.m_GPS_Y
member.summary: Holds the GPS Y value (longitude). If a GPS device is not connected, this will be a default value as set in the load function for this form.

member.name: F:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.m_GPS_Z
member.summary: Holds the GPS Z value (elevation). If a GPS device is not connected, or the NMEA sting does not support elevation, this will be a default value as set in the load function for this form.

member.summary: Date for the current transect

member.summary: Is there a video file currently open or not.

member.summary: Relative rate at which to play the video. 1=regular speed.

member.name: F:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.m_blInTransect
member.summary: Are we in a transect currently or not?

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.frmVideoMiner_Load(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Get version name from assembly, read and process the Config file, and setup the form controls for an unloaded state.
member.param: System.Object
System.EventArgs
member.remarks: From MSDN for Windows.Forms.Control.CheckForIllegalCrossThreadCalls: When a thread other than the creating thread of a control tries to access one of that control's methods or properties, it often leads to unpredictable results. A common invalid thread activity is a call on the wrong thread that accesses the Control 's Handle property. Set CheckForIllegalCrossThreadCalls to true to find and diagnose this thread activity more easily while debugging.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.loadConfigurationFile
member.summary: Load the metadata found in the VideoMiner configuration file into member variables. If the configuration file is not found, defaults will be assigned for GPS settings and the path variables
member.returns: True if all member variables were populated. False if an exceptioon was thrown or the file does not exist

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.SaveConfiguration(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Save a single variable's value to the XML configuration file. If the variable does not exist, a new node, and any parent nodes which are required will be added to the XML document. If forceCreate is true, the node will be created even if one with the same name already exists. This makes dynamic lists possible.
member.param: An XPath String representing the XML node name
The value to save in the node represented by xPath
member.returns: A Boolean representing success or failure

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.DeleteXMLNode(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Delete a node represented by the string 'xPath' eg. if xPath = "X/Y/Z", the function will delete the node Z.
member.param: An XPath String representing the node tag you wish to delete
The value to delete. There can be more than one node with the same tag, so this is required to diferrentiate.
member.remarks: xPath is a "/" seperated string where "/" represents node breaks. i.e. "X/Y/Z" represents X is parent of Y, Y is parent of Z and Z is the node to delete, as long as it has value equal to strValue

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.CreateXMLNode(System.Xml.XmlDocument@,System.Xml.XmlElement@,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Recursively create a node and any required parent nodes represented by the string 'xPath' eg. if xPath = "X/Y/Z", the function will insert a node with parents if necessary X->Y->Z where "Z" is the base case and assumed to be the innerText of the child node.
member.param: A reference to an XmlDocument root node
A reference to a parent to add a new node to. If Nothing, assume docNode is the parent
An XPath String representing the node you wish to add
String representing the value to set the variable to
String representing the xPath to the left of the current node
member.remarks: xPath is a "/" seperated string where "/" represents node breaks. i.e. "X/Y/Z" represents X is parent of Y, Y is parent of Z and Z is the variable with a value to set

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.GetConfiguration(System.String)
member.summary: Get a single variable's value for a given node from the XML configuration file.
member.param: An XPath String representing the XML node name, with children seperated by "/"
member.returns: A String, the value of the requested XML node

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.GetConfigurationCollection(System.String)
member.summary: Get a collection of variables values for a given node from the XML configuration file.
member.param: An XPath String representing the XML node name, with children seperated by "/"
member.returns: A Collection containing the children's values for the requested XML node

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.mnuOpenSession_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: When user selects "Open Session" from the file menu, sub openSession() and open a dialogue where the user can restore a previous session that was being run in the program via a VideoMiner Session file. This restores the last video that was being played.
member.param: System.Object
System.EventArgs

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.mnuSaveSession_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: sub saveSession() when the user selects Save Session from the file menu, and open a dialogue where the user can save the current VideoMiner Session file. This saves which video is currently being played.
member.param: System.Object
System.EventArgs

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.mnuSaveSessionAs_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: sub saveSessionAs() and open a dialogue where the user can save the current state that is being run in the program as a new VideoMiner Session file. This saves which video is currently being played.

Load OpenFileDialog object to prompt user to select a database to open. When the user clicks OK, sub openDatabase and send it the path of the database to open.

member.summary: This handler is called when the user clicks on the "Transect Start" button. Pauses video, prompts user for a transect name, inserts new record in the DataGridView1 database table, and plays the video again.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.timerTick
member.summary: Updates the time text on the form everytime the timer tick event is issued by the frmVideoPlayer form

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.db_file_load
member.summary: Enable some controls when the database is opened

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.db_file_unload
member.summary: Set some controls to be invisible once the database has been closed, and remove the dynamic panel buttons.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.openDatabase
member.summary: Opens the MS Access database, loads one button for each record in the DB_HABITAT_BUTTONS_TABLE table into Panel1: fill_spatialvariable_button_panel(), and loads one button for each record in the DB_SPECIES_BUTTONS_TABLE table into Panel2: fill_speciesvariable_button_panel().

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.fetch_data
member.summary: Fetch the data from the MS Access database into the DataGridView and sets the next unique ID that the database can recieve.
member.remarks: Order of the rows will be by decending primary key ('ID' field)

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.createInsertQuery(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a string which is an 'INSERT INTO' query in access database format.
member.param: Code for the data. This code is found in the DB_DATA_CODES_TABLE table in the access database
Species name as found in the DB_SPECIES_CODE_TABLE table
Species code as found in the DB_SPECIES_CODE_TABLE table
Count of the species given by strSpeciesCode and strSpeciesName
Which side the observation was on given by table DB_OBSERVED_SIDE_TABLE (0=center,1=port,2=starboard)
Distance of observation from the centerline in cm
Length in cm of the observed species
Height measurement for species where length is not the standard measurement (e.g. Tunicate)
Width measurement for species where length is not the standard measurement
Abundance of the species seen (TODO:update this definition)
Confidence value for species ID. See table DB_CONFIDENCE_IDS_TABLE (1=high,2=med,3=low)
Video reviewer's comments

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.get_table(System.String)
member.summary: Load a table in from the currently loaded MS Access database
member.param: The name of the table
member.returns: True if the table was loaded successfully, false otherwise

member.name: F:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.rowWasGood
member.summary: Whether or not the row is synced properly with the database. Used when the user edits a cell value. The cell's row will immediately be colored since the data are now 'dirty' but if the value is of the wrong type (not validated) then this is required to put the row back into the condition it was in before the current edit attempt.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.grdVideoMinerDatabase_CurrentCellDirtyStateChanged(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Triggered when any cell value is changed in the grid. Will update a label telling the user that the data is no longer synced with the database. If the user just types the same value that was in the cell to begin with, the row will be unchanged.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.grdVideoMinerDatabase_DataError(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorEventArgs)
member.summary: Give column and row-specific error message to user. Avoids errors/exceptions during the update to the database.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.grdVideoMinerDatabase_KeyDown(System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView,System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs)
member.summary: Key events for the data grid. The arrow keys will move to adjacent cells, the Enter key will submit the edit (if applicable) and move to the next cell down or, if it is currently the last row, the next cell on the right, or if neither of those, the top left-most cell. Pressing the 'delete' key will delete rows from the grid view and the database.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.grdVideoMinerDatabase_EditingControlShowing(System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView,System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewEditingControlShowingEventArgs)
member.summary: Allow keys to be captured while the editor is focussed on an individual cell

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.TextBox_PreviewKeyDown(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.PreviewKeyDownEventArgs)
member.summary: Sets up the Enter or Return key to be captured by the TextBox, which is a cell in the DataGridView. This is the only way that the Enter key can be used to submit a value when editing a cell.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.deleteSelectedRows(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Deletes selected rows from the MS access database as well as in the grid view. A confirmation box will verify this.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.grdVideoMinerDatabase_RightClick(System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView,System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Captures right click in the DataGridView. This will delete rows from the grid view and the database.
member.remarks: If no rows are selected, a message will tell you to select rows and then press delete

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.grdVideoMinerDatabase_CellValidating(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellValidatingEventArgs)
member.summary: Validate the cell values if user makes them NULL. Avoids errors/exceptions during the update to the database.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.cmdUpdateDatabase_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Update the MS Access database table bound to the data adapter. This allows changes made within the DataGridView to be updated inside the actual database.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.cmdRevertDatabase_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Reload the grid from the access database. A confirmation box will be displayed and if the user aggrees then any changes in the grid will be discarded and the database will be reloaded from scratch

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.setTimes

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.unsetTimes

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.time_changed

member.summary: Handles an event to grab the time from the frmSetTime form.

member.summary: Handles an event to grab the latests data from the GPS device.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.UnHandledHandler(System.Object,System.UnhandledExceptionEventArgs)
member.summary: Handle everything not handled by .NET handlers. This will catch crossthread exceptions as well. Important as it gives a message about the error and the stack trace at the time the exception was thrown.

member.name: M:VideoMiner.VideoMiner.Me_Closing(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.FormClosingEventArgs)
member.summary: When the user clicks the X to close the application, this handles that and closes any open forms and sets them up for garbage collection

member.name: T:VideoMiner.VideoMiner
member.summary: This is the main form for the program, and instantiates most of the other forms.
